loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
The selling of native delicacies made from glutinous rice as well as other types of snacks is the business managed by Esperanza L., who is a resident of Barangay Rizal West in San Isidro, Isabela. She is fifty-seven years old. Esperanza is a loving mother and a caring wife, as well as a business-minded woman. 

She wants to improve her sales by buying more kinds of snacks to sell, which would generate more income. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6,000 for her business growth. Esperanza is married to Marcelino and they are blessed with five children. Three of them are married and the other two are single and currently in school.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Msangara borrower group in Kiboriloni, kilimanjaro. She is 40 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 12 and 8 years old.

Joyce has owned a food business selling fruits(orange)and tomatoes for 5 years.She works 12 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania.

This is Joyce`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more oranges, tomatoes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use  this loan, Joyce  hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and tomatoes

loans.name: Izzatoy

texts.en:
Izzatoy is a hard-working person and over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her two children. She is devoted to raising animals, especially cows which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she makes the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Izzatoy is requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni for purchasing young cattle. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: General store is the business of Melba M.. She is a resident of Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela. She is thankful to have Rolando M., who is a very responsible and a loving husband. Melba wanted to expand her store and buy additional stock of merchandise because their place is far to the marketplace that’s why she is requesting a loan amounting PHP15, 000 for her additional business capital. Somehow, by having the added capital, she could also minimize her fare in going to the marketplace where she bought different kinds of merchandise. She is blessed with six children and she hopes that she could sustain all their needs especially their educational needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en: Viktorya B. was born in 1976. She lives in Sevan with her mother and brother. Her mother is a pensioner. Viktorya’s brother helps her run her own business. She sells fruits and vegetables in the food market. Viktorya needs a 200,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a large lot of grapes, peaches, tomatoes, aubergine, and watermelon for her business. She plans to spend the expected income to obtain furniture for her house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
44-year-old Helen A. and her husband live with their five children in a village close to the seashore of San Jose in the Province where mountains meet the sea - Antique. The livelihood of most people in this village is made by fishing and selling fish. Though Helen’s husband is not one of those, she supports the sources of income of other families by financing a fisherman’s needs for fishing. In return for the financial assistance she extends to a fisherman, she receives half of the profit he earns from his fishing.

It was seven years ago that Helen started this kind of business. She started with a very small amount of money from the savings she was able to set aside from her husband’s daily income from being a driver. In 2004, considering the growing needs of her children, especially in education, Helen wanted to grow her business to further augment her husband’s income. Her oldest child and second child will soon go to college, while the next two children will be in high school, and the youngest in elementary. Helen knew she had to have more income.

Since Helen was able to have access to credit by joining the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2004, she has been able to finance many fishermen in their village. Now she is requesting a larger loan to finance the fishing business of her brother-in-law. Once fish are sold wholesale to a market fish vendor, profit will be shared with her depending on how much has been agreed upon. She also sells some of her share of fish for more income and profit.

loans.use: To financing a fishing business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is already 49 years old and already married to Remegio E.. She is a dealer of beauty products in the village of Rizal West in San Isidro, Isabela. She manages the business for many years now thus she wanted to sustain it. For this reason, she wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 from KIVA lenders for her to purchase all the ordered products by her regular customers. She knows that through that her income will increase.

She is thankful because she has been blessed with three children namely Remelyn - 24 years old, Jasper - 20 years old, both of them are already graduated from college and their youngest is John Mark - 15 years old who is now in his high school studies. Zenaida hopes that she could generate bigger income from her business for her to sustain the needs of her family at home and in school.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is engage in a general store business, a kind of business that is commonly termed as “sari-sari store” in their community. Her income from the business allows her to provide some of the needs of her family. She wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 that will be utilized for the growth of her store and be able to finance the education of her children. 


Marites is married to Cleto B. Jr, 46 years old. She is blessed with three children of whom two are already studying in college and elementary level of education. Her desire to further develop her business is because she wanted her children to grow and learn through their studies from primary to college so that someday they will have a good future.

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. Abdurahim sells both the milk they produce, as well as the grasses that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of additional cows for expanding his business. Please help support Abdurahim’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is already 30 years of age. She is currently residing at Barangay Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela with her twin children and her sister- in- law. Her husband’s name is Albert Allan M. who is a Civil Engineer and is currently working abroad. Their twin are Amira Jane and Amira Claire, they are presently studying in a nursery school in their town at Angadanan, Isabela. 


She manages a mini grocery store in their place for almost 2 years. She also tried selling business for 10 months in their public market. Her weekly average net income from the business is around PHP2, 000 and which is being utilized to roll in her general store and also for the needs of her children. She wanted to avail a loan of PHP25, 000 from KIVA lenders in order to improve her store into a grocery. According to her, because of her children she is patiently managing her business for it to become more progressive.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoun H. is a farmer in Andoung village in Kandal province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a fish breeder. Now she needs a loan to buy more fishes, fish food, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Mean Met, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ngoun H. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishes, fish food, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells drinks and snacks in her shop. Elizabeth lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Elizabeth is very happy with the growing nature of her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
Abduvali S.  is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock and with the proceeds from his business he provides sustenance for his family. Abduvali is married with 4 children. Since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience due to his great dedication and the knowledge he has acquired breeding his animals. The reason why Abduvali looks for support from IMON International is that he needs to purchase additional livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a member of the Sokoni borrower group in Kiboriloni,Kilimanjaro, She is 25 year old woman,she is single.

Vick has owned a Tailoring business  for 5 years. She works 8 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Vick`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more Fabric materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Vick hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As an entrepreneur, Mrs. Rosie G. of Cangapas, Anahaw, Hinigaran City, Negros Occidental, is always looking for great investment opportunities. She is 38 years old, married with 4 children - her oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 10.

Because of the farming activity in the area where Mrs. G. lives, she started a rice trading business - buying rice at harvest time from June to January and reselling milled rice at retail prices to the community and the neighboring towns. The family also owns a small farm which is managed by her husband, and she also put up a "sari-sari" or general store. The 3 business activities helps support the needs of their young family and earns about PHP 6,500 a month.

She plans to use her 15th cycle loan amounting to PHP 29,000 as additional capital for her rice retailing business, the income of which she plans to pay for the school tuition of her children, set aside some amount for their future and invest the rest back into her business. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Rice Retailing

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Mrs. Meng K. is a villager in Preak Phum village in Kandal province. She is a Chinese noodle seller. Her husband, Mr. Ly Krouy, is employed in a Casino Club. Since his workplace is far from the house, he has difficulty in getting to work because a motorbike taxi is an expensive form of transportation.  Mrs. Meng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband drive to work.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora I., aged 47, is a married woman with 5 children. She and her husband are putting all their effort into the farming of potatoes and wheat which they sell to wholesalers. This is paying off since they have recently started the construction of their own house. They wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan for $1700 USD which will help them in their undertaking and allow them to finish the construction of their dream house.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver S. is 39. He lives in Sevan with his family, which consists of his wife and 2 sons. Nver was a policeman for about 17 years. Because of his living conditions he opened a butcher’s shop 7 years ago. Every month he earns approximately 120,000 Armenian dram (about $318 US)  from his business. He needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy a new refrigerator and a modern meat grinder. One of Nver’s sons was entered in an institute for education this year and the expected income of Nver’s business will be used for his son’s education.

loans.use: For a refrigerator and meat grinder

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham R. is 31 years old a resident of Siem Reap Province where she earns a living weaving bamboo purses, as well as farming rice. As another source of family income comes from the own small business of her husband. He has a various music instrument, such as speakers, media players, and generator, on which he uses them to provide a service for wedding parties and other ceremonies. Due to Cham R. saw that her husband’s business is toward to a successful goal and a profitable one as well. She hopes to make this business more successfully; thus, she decided to seek a loan as capital to allow her husband to purchase more music instruments which he uses to continue the good service he provides.

loans.use: To purchase more music instruments

loans.name: Cité De La Gloire Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Cité de la Gloire Plus » est une banque communautaire constituée de 25 membres solidaires dont Yuya est dirigeante. Ce groupe reçoit et rembourse régulièrement des crédits reçus de l’IMF HOPE RDC. 
Yuya M. 55 ans, habite dans la partie montagneuse située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle est active dans la vente d’aliments depuis des années. Elle vend des shikwangues, poissons et la viande des dindes. Elle est mieux connue dans son quartier à cause de la qualité de ses aliments. Yuya est cliente fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC qui a déjà obtenu deux crédits et les a remboursés totalement à temps. Compte tenu de la demande de ses clients qui ne cesse de croitre, elle compte augmenter le stock de ses marchandises avec le prochain prêt, en achetant un sac de shikwangues et un carton de viande des dindes à revendre en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice. Son activité lui procure aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $23 par semaine. Son ambition à court terme est d’acheter un congélateur pour conserver ses marchandises fraiches. Yuya est mariée et mère de 6 enfants et de 2 petits fils. Ses enfants sont âgés de 16 à 33 ans et deux d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Cité de la Gloire Plus is a communal bank composed of 25 members, with Yuya being the manager. This group regularly receives and repays loans from the MFI HOPE DRC. Yuya M. is 55 years old, and lives in the mountainous area west of Kinshasa. She has been active in the the sale of food for many years. She sells shikwangues (a bread made of cassava flour), fish and turkey meat. She is well known in her neighborhood because of the quality of her food products.Yuya is a loyal client of the MFI, HOPE DRC, having already received 2 loans and fully repaid them on time. Considering the growing demand from her clients, she is planning to increase her inventory of products with the next loan, by buying a bag of shikwangues and a carton of turkey meat for resale to increase profits. Her current activities bring her a weekly profit of $23. Her short-term goal is to purchase a refrigerator to preserve her fresh products. Yuya is married, and has 6 children and 2 grandchildren. Her children are between the ages of 16 and 33, and two of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 bag of shikwangues and 1 box of turkey meat for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yandash

texts.en:
I. Yandash is a vegetable farmer. He is widowed and has 7 children. Yandash is the teacher at the local school, but for additional income he has also farmed his land for many years. His sons actively help him with operations. Now his harvest is ready, so Yandash is requesting a loan of $1700 USD to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest. Yandash wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so with the income from his production.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik T. is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in Sevan. Gagik has a secondary education. For the last 4 years he has worked as a foreman and 4 months ago Gagik and his wife began their own business that brings in 90,000 Armenian dram (about $239 US) per month. They have a rented shop, where they sell a mix of products. Gagik and his wife want to receive a 200,000 AMD loan to buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil to expand their start-up business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza, thanks to her work, can offer her children and her family daily nutrition but more than that she feels active and useful for her family and helps her husband. She dedicates herself to the production and sale of potato, carrot and wheat. Although daily this activity takes time and care she does it with a lot of optimism, knowing that thanks to this she can continue growing, not only economically but also as a person. Feruza has many desires to be able to increase her plantation, for this she thinks to acquire more land and different plants to better the variety of her delicious products, as a result she will increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Bann

texts.en: Bann R., 44 years old, is married and the mother of three teenage children who are tailors. The family lives in the best tourism territoR. of Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Bann R. currently works as an internal staff member for a company, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver (he appears in the photo). Bann R. will be using her first loan to allow her children to purchase more sewing machines for their tailoring service.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines for a tailoring service

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia V., 58 years old, is married with 3 children. She lives in Sitio Magtalisay, Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  Virginia strives hard to help increase her family's income. Her main objective is to save enough so that she and her husband can secure a good future for their children, and also to acquire some productive assets that can be used to help increase the family's income.

When Virginia went into the fish vending business 20 years ago, she knew that if she worked hard enough, she could achieve all her goals. The business earns her PHP 6,000 per month, and after her household expenses, she puts the rest back into the business so that she can slowly but surely expand her operations and income capacity.  

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 for her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to add to her revolving working capital, because she plans to use the profits to renovate and repair the family home.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Delie

texts.en:
Delie D. R. is 33 years old. Delie is married to Reynaldo D. R. Sr. who is a classifier of rice and corn in their village of Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela.  She sells different kinds of vegetables in her village.  According to Delie, her vegetable products are very popular. She displays the vegetables in her vending stall. Sometimes she also sells other products that the villagers need. 


She wants to borrow additional capital so the business can grow and increase her income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP6,000. Through KIVA loans, Delie hopes to buy more kinds of vegetables and promote her products to gain more customers. Delie is praying and hoping that she will receive the loan she is requesting from KIVA.

loans.use: additional capital for vegetable business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
At the age of 43 Imelda C. is the mother of six children. For her, having a big family is not easy but being a responsible mother, Imelda is doing her best to maintain her family and provide them with their important necessities, especially their need for education. Her husband is Florentino, who is 48 years old and works as a farmer.

Her dream is to have a growing business and a higher net income to provide for the needs of her children, especially the four who are currently studying. Through her general store, she is able to provide daily allowances for the four children and also help support their daily immediate needs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP8,000 from KIVA lenders as additional capital for her general store.  She hopes that through the loan her business will grow further.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
K. Bashorat, a 44-year-old woman, is married with three children. Bashorat cultivates a small farm, which she has done for more than five years. She grows different types of vegetables and wheat. Everyday she gets up very early. At 5 am, she drives to the produce market in the capital to sell her products, while her husband and sons take care of the daily work on the farm.

Bashorat is very proud of the work they've done together as a family, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home. They have made good use of loans, since nowadays it's very difficult to get ahead without the extra help. Bashorat has applied for a loan from IMON International for the first time. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides that they need for their farm.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila C. sells stick barbecue and iced cold juice in her village of Barangay Caliguian Burgos, Isabela, where her family happily lives. She is 44 years old and is married to Renie C., who is 52 years of age. She sells along their street and earns a little money while her husband is working as a security guard in Antipolo City. They are blessed with five children: two are working in Batangas and three are currently in school.

Prescila is requesting a loan from Kiva of 5,000 PHP to use as additional business capital for her food vending business that is a big help in meeting her family’s daily needs. She dreams of giving her children education, thus she is doing her best to be productive in her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a food business

loans.name: Mitraudi

texts.en:
Mitraudi is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 39 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 16 and 12 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Mitraudi has owned a clothing business selling Fabric materials like Vitenge,Kanga for 2 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a  monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mitraudi`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fabric.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mitraudi hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie P. is a villager maintaining an eatery business. He is 34 years old, married to Elaine, and they have a son, named Russ Evan, who is 3 years of age. His family lives harmoniously in Barangay Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela – a simple town where most residents have their own ways of becoming more productive in their livelihoods.

Before now, Ronie was managing a general store and later decided to shift into an eatery business, which is good, according to him. To expand his business, Ronie decided to request a loan from Kiva lenders of 14,000 PHP. He believes that, with Kiva’s help, he will be able to make his eatery progress.

loans.use: Additional capital for an eatery

loans.name: Gasbamel

texts.en:
Gasbamel C., 39 and single, presently resides with her parents, sisters and her adopted daughter in the village of Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela, where she has managed a retail store for almost four years. She earns a weekly income of PHP3,000 that is being used for the business and to sustain her family needs. Gasbamel is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 as additional capital to grow her business which she patiently manages to ensure its success. 	


.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work must be maintained to become successful in life,” said Jenelyn G.. She is the loving wife of Noli Christopher. They are gifted with a child named Princess Jhen, who is already 1 year old. The couple wants to give their child a better future by giving her the best education they can afford despite their difficulties of life. This couple also strives hard in order to overcome their poor living conditions.

Jenelyn is engaged in selling snacks like native cakes, banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) and also cooked sweet potatoes, in the public market of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband works as a carpenter/laborer in Nueva Vizcaya State University.

Jenelyn hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders for the development of her vending business. With her interest in earning a higher income, she is patiently doing her best and is sacrificing a lot just to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Sherill Jane

texts.en:
Sherill Jane A. is a resident of Barangay Vista Alegre in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 27 years old and finished a secondary level of education. Due to financial difficulty, she was not able to pursue her studies in college.

Sherill works hard and helped her parents to earn a living until she married her husband, Darwin A.. They are blessed with a child who is Stephanie Joyce, 8 years old. Being responsible parents, they want their child to be successful someday.

With this in mind, Sherill wants to borrow PHP 20,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. With the amount she wants to obtain, she hopes that her business income will be increased. That way, she will be able to earn more, little by little, for the future welfare of her family, especially for their only child.

Sherill’s husband works as a technician in Barangay Quirino Solano, Nueva Vizcaya, while Sherill is engaged in buying frozen foods that she sells in their rural village at a higher price so she can generate income. She aims to acquire more products to sell but she does not have enough capital. That is why she is asking for financial capital from Kiva. Furthermore, she will also start a hog-raising business with some of the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita D. manages a general store business in Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela.  She is already 47 years old and is a loving wife to Wilfredo D.. According to her, she wanted to expand her business so that someday, she could sustain all the needs of her family especially her children who are currently studying at the moment. She is earning through her business to finance the tuition fees of her two children namely; Willord - 19 years old and a college student and Ma. Katrina - 14 years old is a high school student. Due to the prevailing price increase of basic commodities, Teresita would like to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 to be able to further expand her store. She hopes that she could avail the loan she is requesting so that she could continue to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
M. Ahmadjon is 43 years old man. He is married and has 3 children. Ahmadjon’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. Ahmadjon is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Istaravshan city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 6 years. Today Ahmadjon is planning to replace the fuel supply system with one using the gas as a fuel change, as the gas is more cheaper than petrol. Also his car needs thorough repair and with this purpose he wants to borrow $ 1000 USD. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system and spare parts for thorough fixing of the car.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is requesting from KIVA lenders for financial assistance amounting to PHP13, 000 that will serve as her additional business capital to her general store located in their village at Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela. She is already 39 years old and is already married to Alvin D. L. who chooses to venture in hog raising business. They have one daughter named Angel Grace, 5 years old and is studying in a nursery school in their town. Her family peacefully lives at the simple village of Angadanan.
 
AsiD. from maintaining her general store, Jovelyn is also employed in TV Cable Network Company in their town of which she is receiving a monthly salary of PHP5, 000 only. Her store is barely 4 months operating, she wanted the business grow in order to meet the needs of her family since her salary is too small and is not enough to support their daily immediate needs. With that she really desires that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rustom

texts.en:
Rustom B. is commonly called “Tom” by his neighbors. He finished a vocational course and now he is happily married to Ma. Dolores and they are blessed with six children. They live happily in a small village located at Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Being interested in giving their children a better future motivated Rustom and his wife to help each other to satisfy their daily basic needs.

Rustom works as a field technician at the National Road of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. His daily income is being invested in his livestock business, which is hog-raising, while his wife is engaged in vending her homemade processed foods in their public market and also to their neighbors.

Rustom is borrowing PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his hog-raising business. The amount will be of big help in enabling him to sustain his business and to improve his living conditions. He aims to improve his piggery by acquiring more piglets and the needed feed supply. He further believes that “patience is the key to success”.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hog raiser in the village of Barangay Rizal West of San Isidro, Isabela. She wanted to buy feeds supply for her raised hogs so that they will grow healthy and in good shape. But unfortunately her income is not enough due to high cost of basic commodities nowadays. With regard to this she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP9, 000 from the KIVA lenders. 


Wanting to give the needs of her family, specially her children, Merlita is really working hard. She wants to further alleviate their poor living condition. Merlita and her husband are blessed with five children, two are already married and three are still studying. She hopes that her hog raising business will become progressive.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jay-Rone

texts.en:
Jay-rone B. is already 23 years old. He is still single and doing his best to help his parents to support their family needs.

Jay-rone operates a tricycle transport business in his village. According to him, he wants to change the old sprocket of his tricycle that he uses in his business because he wants to maintain his motor vehicle to improve it and to increase his daily income.

Jay-rone is requesting PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase the needed spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport. He hopes and prays that he will obtain the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda manages a typical village store in the simple village of Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela.  Aside from managing her store, she is also into vending of vegetables. From those businesses she is earning a weekly income of PHP3, 000 that is being revolved in the business to grow. In connection to this she wanted to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP6, 000 as additional business capital for her store and vending of vegetables. 


Esmeralda is already 55 years old, she is married to Leoncio and they are blessed with 3 children namely; Alexander - 37 years old, Bernie - 36 years old, followed by Froilan - 35 years of age, and they also have an adopted child named Evangeline who is now 16 years old, and now a college freshman. Esmeralda hopes to give her adopted child a good education for her to have a better future someday thus, she is hoping to improve her business more.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is already 45 years old. She lives, together with her family, at Barangay Rizal West, San Isidro, Isabela. She is engaged in a business making cradles. She sells her cradles in their village and in other nearby villages as well.

Lolita is happily married to Demetrio D.. The couple is blessed with six children namely: Freddie - 23 years old, a high school graduate; Sherwin - 21 years old, a college graduate; Glenda - 18 years old, a high school graduate; Raymund - 16 years old, an elementary school graduate; and Elpidio - 14 years old, and Lovely - 11 years old, both elementary school pupils.

Lolita is asking for additional working capital for her business development. She believes that having enough capital will pave the way towards the success of her vending. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Aide Plus » est une banque communautaire constituée de 29 membres dont André U. est président. Elle est solidairement unie et engagée à recevoir des crédits de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC. 
André U. 26 ans, est micro-entrepreneur dans le monde de communication. Il gère sa propre cabine téléphonique et vend des cartes prépayées. Le nombre de ses clients ne cessent de croitre et le poussent à augmenter la quantité des cartes prépayées qu’il compte acheter avec le prochain crédit. André travaille durement avec détermination pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un shop d’accessoires téléphoniques qui sont bien vendus dans son milieu. Il est âgé  de 26 ans, célibataire sans enfant.
texts.en:
“Aide Plus” is a community bank made up of 29 members, with André U. as president. The bank is firmly united and engaged to receive loans from Kiva via the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC.

André U., 26, is a micro-entrepreneur in the communication business. He manages his own phone booth and sells prepaid cards. His customers do not cease to grow in number. The next loan will allow him to increase the number of prepaid cards that he can buy. André works hard and with determination in order to realise his dream of one day opening a shop selling telephone accessories in his local area. He is 26 years old, single and has no children.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on prepaid telephone cards for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria E. wants to request a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to further sustain her beauty service business in the village of Caliguian, Burgos, Isabela where her family also lives.

Victoria is now 42 years old and married to a driver named Albert E., 46 years of age. She is blessed with three children namely: Jenalyn, Mary Joy, and Albert. Her first child is working in a computer company while her second child is her partner in their beauty service business, providing services such as manicure, pedicure and hair dressing, especially during special occasions.

Through the amount that she is requesting, Victoria believes that she will be able to buy different colors of nail polish, chemicals for different hairdressing that could fit their customers’ choice and some other beauty services they could offer.

Victoria’s income in the business is of big help in sending her youngest child to school. Sometimes, Victoria also roams house to house to look for customers. She loves the business and so is dedicated in sustaining the business and making it grow.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory D. R. is about 55 years old. She is engaged in a hog-raising business that is situated at her house in Barangay Rizal, west of San Isidro, Isabela. According to her, hog-raising is quite difficult, especially when there is an attack of livestock diseases. It is a little like gambling, says Glory, because she gambles her capital in the business and is not sure if she will earn more in managing the business.

Glory would like to buy her stock of feed for the maintenance of her hogs. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to continue her business plans and to be able to generate a good income for her family. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders to develop her hog-raising business. According to her, this loan will be of big help to her hog-raising business. She will be thankful if this amount of loan is granted.

loans.use: To use for business development

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Selling under the heat of the sun and sometimes in the rain are the sacrifices Elena A. makes to help her husband support the needs of their family. She sells eggs, cooked balut (chicken embryos), salted eggs and snacks from her pedicab.

Elena is 41 years old and is married to Eduardo, whose occupation is farming. They are blessed with five children, but only three of them are sent to school because of financial problems. The other two children temporarily stopped their schooling and are helping the family earn a living.

Elena drives her pedicab around the village regularly, selling the same products. She wants the business to progress, so she asked for a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP7,000 to use as additional business capital. She hopes the loan will give her the chance to create a more productive business.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. is 43 years old and married to Reynaldo D.. Because her husband is a farmer, their main source of income is through farming (they grow rice). Now, at the start of the business, they’re renting the land of a close relative.

Some of their income also comes from selling different kinds of food, and their employed children also give them money from their salaries. Though there are several sources of income, Melanie and Reynaldo focus on farming because it gives them more income. Their earnings need to support their daily needs and also the expenses for the education of their other children.

That’s why Melanie joined and requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc (ASHI), to pay for things that are needed in farming, like fertilizer and pesticide, and also to pay laborers. She is really happy running this business because they love the land that they cultivate. She is hoping that this business will succeed and that they will have a better life.

loans.use: To finance her rice farming business

loans.name: Khadeyge

texts.fr: khadeyge S. est une sociétaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis 2005.c'est une mère de famille qui a l'intention de relancer son commerce de tissus.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son capital de roulement.c'est une mère de famille qui participe a l'entretien de sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en: Consejo P. is now 57 years old married to Rogelio P.. Ana Rose is their only child who is now 15 years of age. Because of the lack of means of income their only child Ana Rose only attains a primary level of education. This situation is the reason why Consejo think to expand her existing business which is a variety store that sells different things that mostly needed by a typical family. Her business starts when she joined in Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Although her business earns income, it only support their daily needs in the house, but it can’t support the other expenses of the family like the education of her daughter. She really dreams of her only daughter to gets a degree on college through her hard working and of course with the help also of her husband. That’s why she decided to loan again in Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), this was her second time to loan money. She will be using it for the expansion of her variety store. She wants to buy more items like softdrinks, canned goods and different kinds of groceries to sell in her store to get a more income for them. Also she plan to get into buy and sell of different kinds of clothes that she will get in Divisoria, a place in Philippines that sell different clothes in lower prices, so that she will earn a much higher income. She really wants a better life for them as a family that’s why she never stops seeking for way to fulfill it.

loans.use: Will be used to buy items for her variety store

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat sells fresh and smoked fish. She is 50 years old and married with six children. She is very determined to pull her family out of poverty. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase fish to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet E. is a 42 year old entrepreneur running her own meat selling business for almost seven years. Her membership in ASHI in 2005 enabled her to have an access to credit. Since then, her business had start growing.  Before, Janet can only finance butchering a piece of pig and sell pork per kilo to the people in their small village in partnership of her husband who is a skilled slaughterman. After she has the opportunity of availing credit, she was able increase the volume of pigs to slaughter and sell not only in their own village but in the stall she was able to put in the market.  
Present loan Janet is requesting will be used for financing her present business. She wished to increase further the number of pigs they slaughter everyday and also she wants to purchase equipments needed for butchering for her husband and his co-workers become more efficient. Loan she requests will also be used to pay her stall’s quarterly license. 
Despite of the success Janet is having right now, she still dreams to grow her business further to be able to send all of her four children to college until graduation out of the profit her business makes. Loans she gets from ASHI is a great opportunity she has to achieve all her dreams for business and family.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her meat selling and butchering business.

loans.name: Khadeyge

texts.fr: khadeyge S. est une societaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis 2002 qui capitalise une certaine experience en  credit.elle souhaite relancer son commerce de tissus et sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son capital de roulement.c'est une mere de famille qui contribue a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khadeyge S. has been a member of the Caisse de Baye Laye since 2002, and has some experience with loans. She wants to relaunch her textile business and is looking for a loan of one hundred and fifty thousand (150 000) francs to secure her starting capital. She is a mother of a family, and she is also contributing to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Textile business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
I can say that Victoria Z. is a tough woman, because at the age of 59, she is already a widow but still continues on with her life. Her husband passed away, but she continues living for her children. She is now living with them. Some of them are now employed, which provides the family's income. But, as ordinary employees in a company their combined salaries are not enough for the expenses of the whole family. That’s why Victoria runs a hog fattening, or the raising of pigs, business that can provide them extra income.

Her business started with two pigs and later on increased in number. Now she wants to buy additional pigs to raise and to buy feed for them. So she joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), so that she can borrow the money she needs for growing her business. She hopes that through her determination her business will succeed.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna L. is the frustrated mother of three children: Michael, who is 17 years old, Liezel who is 15, and KC, who is only 3. Edna is 44 years old, and although frustrated in her children, she is happily married to her husband Emelke L.. She is frustrated because, at their young ages, Michael and Liezel are already married. Michael did not finish his college courses, and Melanie got married right after high school graduation. Edna does not want that to happen again with her youngest child.

The hardest part of it is that the families of her married children still count on her and her husband for financial support. The source of Edna and Emelke's income is their mini-general store, which never provides enough money for their big family.

Edna now wants to start a new business, which is hog fattening or the raising of pigs. She is sure that this business will provide more income, because it suits their place. They have a big backyard for the building of the piggery house. Before starting this business, she needs capital that she can use to buy the piglets and their feed, as well as for the construction of the piggery house. She joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), so that she can borrow capital to start her business. She is hoping that this business will provide their big family's needs.

She is also really hoping that her youngest child will finish her studies and find a better future ahead.

loans.use: Capital to start a hog fattening business (raising of pigs)

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 56 years old and is engaged in a direct-selling business of AVON products. She purchases beauty products and other personal items for men and women from the AVON company outlet in Santiago City and makes a monthly payment. She delivers her purchased products to her customers and will collect their payments twice or three times a month. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP7,000 from KIVA lenders in order to increase her income in the business and become more successful. She would like to buy additional products to sell so that she could also gain more profit for her family's needs. 

Warlita is married to Dominador D. Sr. The couple is blessed with a boy named Dominador D. Jr., and he is now a college graduate. She hopes to use the loan for the continuous development of her direct-selling business in their village of Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fidelito

texts.en:
Fedelito S., Sr. has a business repairing gas stoves in the village of Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela. He is 49 years old and is happily married to Noemi. Noemi is an OFW (overseas Filipino worker). She went abroad to help earn for the future of their children. The couple is blessed with four children who are: Nomelyn, 23 years old and a college graduate; Lizel, 20 years old and just finished her Hotel and Restaurant Management course; Moris, 17 years old and a high school graduate; and Fedelito S., Jr., 15 years old and currently a high school student. 

Fedelito works at his repair business and sometimes also works on his man made stoves, made out of cement and recycled stove materials, which makes a good kind of cooking stove. Fedelito wanted a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to maintain his business and become successful someday.  He hopes to get a loan of PHP6,000 that will be utilized for the development of his repair and manufacturing business and ultimately for the welfare of his beloved family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is already 42 years old. He is married to Melinda M.. The couple is thankful because they are already blessed with one child named Rea who is now 23 years old.  She did not able to finish college due to financial difficulties and early marriage. Though her daughter got married early, still Reyanldo and his wife is doing their best in order to sustain the needs of their grandson. Reynaldo aims to fulfill his family’s satisfaction by patiently maintaining his motorcycle transport with a daily route from their village to highway junction. He wanted also to borrow loan from KIVA lenders that is amounting to PHP9, 000 for the repair and maintenance of his motor vehicle used in transportation business. Reynaldo shares that the loan if granted will be of great help to his family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 35 years old and married to Romeo P.. She manages a small carinderia (or food vending stall) while her husband makes cement stoves. The couple does their best to continue to raise their children well through maintaining their carinderia, located in their village at Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela.   

Delia wanted to develop her business so that she could encourage more customers to eat in her simple carinderia, which would increase her daily income. According to Delia, her current capital is not sufficient to maintain her business, so she wants to borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP5,000 to help her business to grow. This would do a lot for her business, especially in providing for the needs of her family. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her the loan.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is thankful because of the blessings that she had received in her life. She is 52 years old and happily married to Wilfredo L.. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest is Joel who is now 30 years old and a college graduate; next is Julius - 29 years old who is a college graduate also, third is Jeffrey - 21 years old, a college graduate also and the youngest is Jennifer - 5 years old and in grade school. Josephine is a dressmaker and at the same time she is also a dealer of cosmetics products in their village. She needed additional capital in order to strengthen her tailoring business and also to improve her cosmetics direct selling activity. That’s why Josephine is requesting a loan from KIVA amounting to PHP10, 000 for her business improvement. She said that through this amount that she is requesting, she will be able to provide the educational needs of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 60 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 20 and 32. Two of her children go to school. Rose owns a three-room house where she lives with four people. There is no electricity or piped water in the home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week, selling to about 30 customers a day. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one the busiest places in Kampala city. The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs and seasonality.

Rose has been in this business for six years, and with the Kiva field partner, MCDT, also for six years. She is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like sugar, salt and soap. Rose is hoping to see her business grow bigger and wants to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for shop

loans.name: Joeboy

texts.en:
“Joey” short for Joeboy is already 25 years old yet he is still single at present. After finishing his Secondary level of education, Joey decided to stop his studies and rather indulged himself into transportation business to help his parents in sending his other sisters and brothers in school. They are 12 in the family and life is too difficult for them. He is hoping that someday he could uplift their living condition out from poverty.

Joey is engage in transportation business where he operates his own passenger tricycle via Tumauini to Cabagan and vice versa. He would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to have fund in purchasing wheels and other needed parts for his motorcycle need. He hopes to avail the loan for the maintenance of his passenger tricycle. His purpose to earn income is to help his parents in sustaining their needs in the family especially his sisters and brothers who are still studying.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana L. is venturing into managing a hog-raising business. She believes that hog-raising is a good kind of business that would really contribute to her family. She is only 19 years old, very young, but despite her young age, she has the strong determination to cope with the difficulties of life.

She lives in Barangay Rizal West, San Isidro, Isabela. Ana works hard in order to earn more income for her family's needs. She is requesting additional business capital from Kiva lenders in order to have enough funds to buy the needed supply of feed for her hogs. Ana is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5,000 for this purpose. She would be very thankful if this amount would be granted by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a tailor and she also sells clothes and tailoring materials. She is 30 years old and married with three children.

Blessing hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo M. sells jewellery in a transparent box at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi.   Kwadwo has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a farmer.  Kwadwo has been selling jewellery in a transparent box since 1999.  He is responsible for paying fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy more jewellery for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: To buy more jewellery for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 52-year-old widow with eight children between the ages of 17 and 36 years. She sells goods from a shop. She has been in this business for the last 30 years.

Rebecca lives and works seven days a week in a semi-urban area. She rents a three-room house where she lives with some of her children. There is electricity but no piped water in her home. Her major monthly expense is food. The family gets three meals a day. Four of her children go to school.

The major challenges Rebecca faces in her business are transport costs and competition. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Rebecca has been with MCDT for 10 years working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock to be able to serve more customers. Rebecca hopes to see her business grow so she can build herself a house.

loans.use: To buy boxes of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. sells buys raw rice cooks them and sells in small quantities to at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi.  Adjowa has received junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjowa has been selling cooked rice in small quantities since 2003.   She is responsible for paying to support in the payment of utility bills and fees of the children. Her loan will be used to increase her income so as to buy more rice and other cereals to bring variety in the business and the type food she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her income so as to buy more rice and other cereals to bring variety in the business and the type food she sells.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 34-year married woman with six children aged between, 25 to 15 years.  All her children go to school.  Margret rents a two-roomed house where she stays with of her children. There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area and works six days a week.  Charcoal has a high market and she serves about 20 people a day.  She incurs extra transport to and from shopping as she buys the charcoal from the next township, Bwaise. The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs and seasonality.  She sells her charcoal from a market stall. Her major monthly expense is food and school fees. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Margret has been with MCDT for six years working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more sacks of charcoal.  Margret is aspiring to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Chultem

texts.en:
Chultem has run a taxi business since 2005 and has gained a lot of experience in the last four years. He is a 45-year-old humble hardworking man, who lives with his family in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His two older children are university students and the youngest attends a secondary school.

His business has been quite successful, as Chultem has increased his working capital from 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD) to 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). The success of his business brings him profits that have enabled him to pay his childrens' university tuition fees. His wife takes care of their livestock which provide for their family's dairy and meat needs. Chultem says, "My dream is to see my children educated and having a quality life." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1,380 USD) loan to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel C. is single and has one child. He has no educational background. Samuel goes to the forest, cuts weak trees and branches of old trees and sells them as firewood at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi, which he has been doing since 2007.

Samuel uses his income for payment of fees for the child and payment of utility bills. Samuel will use the loan to pay for equipment to enable him to improve the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to save to take care of his child’s education.

loans.use: To pay for equipment to improve the efficiency of his work.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Charcoal has a large market and Justine serves about 15 people a day. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also hawks clothes around her residence and nearby places. She is a 34-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 8 and 14 years.

Justine lives and works six days a week in a semi-urban area. She rents a one-room house where she lives with her children. There is electricity but no piped water in her home. Her major monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees. The family gets three meals a day. All her children go to school.

The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs and moving from place to place selling clothes. She incurs extra expense transporting goods to and from shopping. Justine has been with MCDT for four years, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock. Justine hopes to establish a stall in the market, where she can sell her clothes.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Isaac Benjamin

texts.en:
Isaac Benjamin O. sells firewood. He goes to the forest, cuts wood, and sells it at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi. He has received senior high school education and is married with eight dependents. His wife is a trader.

Isaac Benjamin has been selling firewood since 2004. He is responsible for the payment of school fees and the settlement of bills. His loan will be used to buy more firewood for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards the maintenance of his cocoa farm.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 50 years old and married with seven children. She sells clothes and shoes. This business is her source of income. She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter A. is married and has five dependents. His wife is a trader. He has received senior high school education.

Peter sells firewood. He goes to the forest and cuts wood for sale at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi, which he has been doing since 1997.

Peter uses his income to pay school fees and to settle bills. He will use the loan to purchase more firewood to sell. Peter plans to save the new profits from his expanded business to enter into farming.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a 38-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 1 and 17. Four of her children go to school. She rents a three-room house, where she is staying with her children. Zaina takes care of additional family members (parents).  There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

Zaina rents a stall in the Owino market, where she also purchases second-hand clothes. She sells to an average of 10 people a day. Zaina uses public transport to and from work. Her major monthly expenses are food, health care and school fees. Zaina has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her eighth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock.
.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 48-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 12 and 26. Four of her children go to school. She owns a three-room house, where she is staying with her children. Ruth takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.  

Ruth rents a stall where she sells raw food (matooke, or green bananas). She sells to an average of 15 people a day.  Ruth uses public transport to and from work. Her major monthly expenses are health care and school fees. Ruth has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella is a 26 year married woman with two children aged 5 and 1 year. The 5 year child goes to school. She rents a two roomed house where she is staying with her children.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.   The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  Pamella rents a stall where she sells raw food (Sweet Potatoes) in a nearby town, Wandegeya.  She sells to an average of 10 people a day.  Pamella uses public transport to and from work.  Her major monthly expenses medication.  Pamella has been with MCDT for eight years and servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates for five years. She wants to use this loan to expand he business.
.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin is already 25 years old and is engaged in operating a passenger tricycle.

Aldrin is married to Mary Jane, who is now 23 years old, and they are blessed with three children. Their eldest is Shera May, 6 years old, followed by Kyla who is 5 years old and their youngest is Aldrin Jr., who is barely 6 months old. As head of the family, Aldrin is hoping to provide for the needs of his family by working hard in his present business.

Aldrin would like to request a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 5,000 to be able to maintain the operation of his motorcycle transport business. Some of the spare parts that he needs to buy are gaskets, bearings, sprockets, and other materials for his motorcycle. He hopes that his loan will be granted because this is his chance to further improve his daily transport business.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Pathan

texts.fr: pathan M. est une ancienne societaire tres active de la caisse de baye laye.elle capitalise une grande experience dans la commercialisation d'huile de palme de poissons seches.elle sollicite un credit de cinq cent mille car elle voyage regulierement sur la casamance pour se procurer ses produits.elle apporte un grand soutient a sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay makes a living through his transportation business which he started three years ago. Sometimes, he also does house painting to have an extra income for the sustenance of his family’s needs.

Jay needs financial assistance for the maintenance of his motorcycle that he uses in his transport business. With regard to this he is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to be able to purchase the needed materials for his motorcycle’s maintenance. He is hoping that his loan will be granted so that he can pursue his business and provide sufficient income for his family.

At the age of 22, Jay is already a father. His son is now five years old and presently studying in the primary school. Jay married Maylyn Suguitan at the age of 15 and now has an early obligation to his family. But he does not regret being married at an early age because he is very happy having his wife and his son as his inspiration in life. Because of them, he learned to become responsible and to strive for the better.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is already 41 years old. She is married to Jimmy M. who serves as a Barangay (district) electrician in their village at Barangay Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. Her husband is already 43 years old and working as a farmer. They are gifted with two children: the eldest is taking her college level of education, and the youngest is still in high school. Erlinda is willing to continue financing her children until they finish their college education so long as she can afford to do so. 

Erlinda is trying to do her best and patiently maintains her hog-raising business in order to provide her family with their basic necessities and to fulfill their needs, especially the children’s education.

She wants her livestock business to become productive someday and thus she wanted to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders with the loan of PHP 8,000. Through the amount she wants to borrow, she will purchase enough supply of fattening feeds for her pigs. She hopes that someday, her hog-raising will become a success.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny has been 15 years engage in his transportation business. This is the main source of his family’s daily income and he is hoping that his business will survive as long as he has the strength to operate his passenger tricycle. Danny would like to ask for financial assistance to finance the needed maintenance of his motorcycle thus he is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000.00 to KIVA lenders. Aside from driving his passenger tricycle, Danny is also raising hogs in order to have an extra source of income. He has a big family and he is hoping to sustain their needs especially the studies of his children.


Danny is already 42 years old and he already has six children who are all studying. She is married to Sonia, who helps him in supporting the needs of their children. Danny hopes to provide the educational needs of her children because they also have dreams to finish their degrees in college. He is now currently sending three of his children in college that is why he uses his time wisely in his business just to provide them with sufficient financial support.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 42-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. He works as a car painter. He requested a loan of 1,200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Kamal is special in his work because of his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Kamal first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his shop

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is hoping to obtain financial assistance from Kiva lenders for his hog-raising business that is situated in his house located at Barangay Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. He is involved in his farming business which is the major source of income for most of the residents in his village.

Due to lack of financial capital, Virgilio is requesting to borrow PHP 3,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. 

Virgilio is already 55 years old and is married to Antonia who is now 52 years of age. The couple is luckily blessed with four children.

Virgilio’s dream is to continue his hog-raising business to support his family’s daily needs and the education of their younger children as well. He wants his children to finish their college education in order for them to live a progressive life.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Jonervin

texts.en:
Jonervin A. is engaged in a general-store business in his rural village of Malalinta San Manuel, Isabela. His daily income from the business allows them to meet their daily immediate needs at home. His wife, Clarita, is already 29 years old and helps him in managing their store for it to become progressive. Moreover, the couple even maintain rice and corn fields in their village since their place is an agricultural area.

In connection with that, he wants to again borrow a loan of PHP8,000 from Kiva lenders in order to develop their business more.  He hopes to double their income through the loan he is anticipating to borrow. He is working very hard in order to give their future children a good life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
