This is Lidya`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more saloon goods like shampoo.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lidya hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for saloon

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer was born in 1975. He lives in the city of Baku. He has run this business for 3 years now. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en: Shakhla is applying to Kiva for her second loan. She is enjoying running her business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy cloth to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of the Manazi midle borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 27 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are  9 and 7 years old.

Sarah has owned a food business selling tomatoes, anions for 3 years. She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Sarah`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sarah hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Due to our uncontrollable economic crisis, many are jobless and hopeless for their future. But, according to Marieta U., the ability to rise to the task is within us, with mercy from God. This principle in life has motivated Marieta to work harder towards the progress of her business and her family's living situation. She is only a high school graduate but she has the strong faith and determination to become successful through her patience in doing her business. She is married to Mario U. and they are blessed with two children. They do their best to finance the schooling of their children.
Maritea is venturing into a fish selling business, however, her capital is yet inadequate. This has meant that, so far, the business has not grown. This issue motivated her to request a loan of PHP7,000 from ASKI and Kiva lenders, as additional business capital. She will utilize this amount, if it is granted, to buy a larger volume of fish to sell in her village. She would be thankful for this financial assistance because it would help her very much to improve her fish vending business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is a tricycle operator in the village of Andres Bonifacio, Diffun, Quirino. She is young and full of determination. Being an operator of a tricycle is risky but Evelyn does not care because she needs the additional income for her family to survive.

According to Evelinda, the family's daily needs are met by her passenger tricycle. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP 5,000 to be able to buy new sprockets and other parts needed for her tricycle. Evelinda and her husband are thankful because they are blessed with three children: Maria Erika, 10 years-old and in grade five, Roselyn Jade, 7 years-old and in grade two and Danilo Jr., who is 3 years-old. She hopes that she will be able to get the loan in order the help the family.

loans.use: To purchase tricycle parts

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
The ultimate goal of every individual is to become successful in life in order to satisfy the needs of their family in particular the children. Likewise, Maricris aims to become successful in her business in order to experience and enjoy the essence of life. Despite her lack of education, she believes that through patience and hard work, her family will attain their goals someday.

To meet this goal, her husband Angelito farms which is their major source of income. In order to earn additional income, Maricris has a general store at home. She would like to borrow PHP 13,000 from Kiva lenders in order to further develop her simple store. She plans to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Charlie is managing a barber shop in their village. He is happily married to Ana. They are gifted with two children who are, Baby Jane-2 years old and Milka-3 months old. Wanting to further improve her business and somehow uplift their living condition, Charlie decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders. He knows that the amount will be of great help to his family needs.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Remely

texts.en:
Remely is a persevering mother who patiently manages a small store in their rural village of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Despite the hardship of life, she remains strong and determined to fight against poverty. She also pursued her college studies until she is able to earn a degree in college. She is married to Edwin T. and they are blessed with two children. They have a great ambition to their children hence, they are striving hard to support their education.  
	Remely wanted to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional business capital for her store. She hopes her store become progressive and be able to become successful in her chosen business through the amount she hopes to avail. According to her, the business is of big help in supporting the needs of her family especially her children. She has an estimated weekly income of PHP1, 000 which she utilized to pay the tuition fees and allowances of their children and also to pay her weekly amortization. She aims that someday, she can able to convert her humble store into a grocery store with the continuous support of Kiva loans.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Vending of dishwashing liquid and detergent soap is the business of Concepcion T.. She is 44 years old and married to Pepito T.. The couple is blessed with three children namely: Carla Joy, 23 years old and a college graduate; Jayson-21 years old and also a college graduate; the youngest is Jaypee who is only 19 years old. 

	

Concepcion’s business is improving but she still needs to continue what she has started to sustain the needs of her family. In connection to that, she would like to request a loan amounting PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders. She would be glad if her loan request will be granted. According to Concepcion, sacrifice is necessary for her business to prosper.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 31 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 7 and 5 years old.

Hamida has owned a clothing business selling Fabric (Vitenge,kanga) for 6 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Hamida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge and kanga.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan , Hamida hopes to pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga(Fabric)

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is engaged in vegetable vending business. She is already 30 years of age and is married to Larry E., a driver of vegetable truck and was task to travel in some places to deliver vegetables. They have 2 children namely; Dharence - 8 years of age, grade 3, and Lerry Mae - 4 years old, studying in kinder garten. With her parent in-law, her family happily lives in their rural area of Nungnungan Cauayan City. 

	She wanted to borrow loan amounting to PHP4, 000 from the lenders to able develop her vending stall business where she sell vegetables, and some other vending products that were sailable. She hopes to improve her vending with the amount she hoping to avail. Cynthia said, patience will make her successful someday and she hardly prays for it.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“Use all your opportunities to attain your goals” says Lydia T. of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After her graduation from college, she married Mario T. Sr. and they are blessed with four children. Being an industrious mother, the three oldest children have already finished their college studies and have begun their chosen professions. The youngest has not yet completed school. Lydia is really proud of all of them.

Her husband cultivates their farm lot by planting rice and vegetables for two crops a year. Lydia uses her time to manage their community based store and operate direct selling of AVON products in their village. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to provide additional capital for her store and direct selling business. She hopes that lenders will provide her the loan in order to improve her livelihood and allow her to be of further help to her husband.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia P. is a direct seller of AVON, MSE and Natasha products. Due to lack of job opportunities, she and her husband ended up cultivating a small parcel of farm land which they inherited from their ancestors. They plant rice and vegetables.

Emilia and her family live happily in the peaceful community of Barangay Villa Coloma of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished her studies in college before she got married to Neftali P.. They are blessed with two children: Dann Nathaniel and Eunessly. Both of the children are now in elementary school. Emelia has great ambition for her children. She wants them to be successful in their studies and careers someday.

Despite the difficulties of life, Emilia and her husband are striving to earn a living and support the financial needs of their children. Emilia wants a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will be rolled into her direct selling business to make it grow. She aims to improve this business so that she can earn a higher income to ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: To improve a direct selling business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
“Progress in life depends on how you carry out your duties and responsibilities in life,” says Antonia T. of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is happily married to Jaime Ernesto T. and they are blessed with six children: four boys and two girls. Two of the children have graduated from college, while some of the others did not pursue studies in college because they got married at an early age. Their youngest is presently studying in college.

Antonia's husband works as a laborer in their village, and sometimes he uses their motor vehicle for transport services to help her generate a higher income to meet their daily needs and support the education of their youngest child. Antonia (called "Inday") manages a general store business where she sells a variety of commodities, vegetables and some other products. She wants a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional business capital, so that she can further improve her store. According to her, “Patience is the key to success,” thus, she works very hard for the welfare of her family and has a good business. She hopes that she can improve her business and earn a higher income with the financial help of Kiva.

loans.use: Additional capital for a store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“Progress in life begins with patience and sacrifices” is the guiding principle of Francisca G., who lives in Barangay Kinacao Baretbet Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is happily married to Oscar G. Sr. and they are gifted with six children. Oscar manages a vulcanizing shop while Francisca patiently manages their store at home. She also sells live tilapia (fish) in her store. Four of their children have already finished their studies in college and two of them are still studying at the tertiary level.

Francisca and her husband strive to develop their business and pursue success in their business undertakings for the future welfare of their children. She wants to avail of another loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for additional business capital that will be used to further improve and expand her general store. She hopes to increase her daily income to secure her children’s future welfare by continuing to send them to school till they finish a degree in college.

loans.use: Additional capital for a store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 56, a resident of Brangay Nungnungan Cauayan City, has raised hogs for almost 16 years, earning around PHP2 000 when she sells her livestock every four months. Currently raising four pigs, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to maintain the feed supply of her livestock.

Virginina is married to Ernesto G., a tricycle driver, and they have three children: Janice - 24 years old, a teacher, followed by Ernesto Jr. - 22 years old, college graduate, and Joey - 21 years old, studying at the college level. The entire family, including an adopted daughter, lives together happily. Virginia provides the main financial support for the family.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, commonly known by her nickname “Letty,” is 51 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is Patricio T. and they live in a good relationship with their four children in the rural community of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Some of her children are currently studying in high school, while her eldest child works as a saleslady in their public market to help them support the family's important needs.

Their main source of income is derived from farming, practised by her husband, while Leticia manages a sari-sari store to earn additional revenue for the family. In order to achieve a higher income, she is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to purchase stocks of soft drinks and establish a small eatery that will be part of her business expansion.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza, 26, is a vegetable and fruit vendor within the village of Andres Bonifacio Diffun Quirino. She would like to buy additional vegetables and fruits in order to generate a larger income for her family needs. Annaliza is requesting a loan  of PHP5,000 as additional business capital.  She believes that through that loan she will be able to achieve all of her business dreams.  Aside from managing the business, Annaliza plays the role of a good wife to Mengfei Q..

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. whom they called “Josie” in their village is operating a humble store. She earns income from the business and it is very helpful in providing for their family daily needs. She is a loving housewife of Philip C.. They live happily with their three children in the rural community of Barangay Villa Coloma of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. 
In this regard, Jocelyn wanted to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital for the growth of her small store. Aside from managing her simple store, Jocelyn also manages to buy and sell frozen foods to increase further her daily income. Weekly, Jocelyn only earns a net income of PHP600, too little for their growing necessities. Because of her interest to earn more income, she wanted to acquire more items for her sari-sari store in order to increase her income. She hopes that she can able to improve her business with the help of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita L. is engaged in maintaining a general store located in Barangay Kinacao Baretbet in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now a widow and she has two children: Vener and Vanessa. Through her patience and sacrifices, her two children have finished their studies in college. The eldest is presently working as a caregiver in Canada while the youngest is employed as a government secretary in Solano.

Since Juanita is already blessed with her two children, she aims to become successful in life to also help her cousins, who can’t afford to send their children to school, and also to save for the future.

In this regard, Juanita continues to manage her store patiently and lovingly to become productive. She wants to borrow additional business capital of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders for her to acquire her products like grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods. Because of her interest in improving her store, Juanita is hoping that Kiva will somehow lend her the amount. That will be of big help towards the success of her business.

Juanita also believes that, through her strong faith and determination, her business will grow and expand through the continued financial support of Kiva.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland B., 40 years old, is married to Cynthia B.. According to him, big capital is needed in his catering business but, sad to say, he doesn’t have enough capital. Thus he would like to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 to further use in purchasing additional kitchenware so that he can complete his set of utensils needed in his catering.

Roland’s wife, Cynthia, is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). This couple is grateful for they have been blessed with two children: Josh Roland - 10 years old and Jeanne - 9 months old. Roland stands as both a mother and a father to his two children due to the absence of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchenware

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 10 and 7 years old.

Madina has owned a business selling crops for 4 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Madina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops like maize,beans.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Madina hopes to pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops like Maize, Beans

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Going into business for one's self is not an easy occupation - there is no safety net and no one to run to when things go wrong or when problems arise. This is what Mrs. Remedios J., a 52-year-old married woman from Central Tabao, Zone 4, Valladolid, Negros Occidental realized when she started her fish-vending and seafood processing business. But with five children to raise and educate, she knew that it was the only way if she wanted to provide them with a good education and a good future. Before Mrs. J. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, her need for additional capital for her business pushed her to deal with the moneylenders and their exorbitant interest rates. This situation piled more problems on her business because the high interest rate demanded by the moneylenders added more burden to the business. This is the reason why she is very thankful that she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. And because she values the service that NWTF-Project Dungganon is providing her, she makes sure that she pays back her loans on time. After Mrs. J. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, with the easy-payment scheme, she was able to sustain her business. With the help of the loans she borrowed over the years, most of the difficulties in her business were ironed out - even the problem of transporting the products to the market. Where, before, she had to pay a high price to rent a truck to make her deliveries, now she has her own truck and this is no longer a problem. She has also acquired a tricycle - a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers - which adds to her daily cash flow. Mrs. J. is very grateful that her efforts are now starting to pay off, and three of her children are slowly settling into their own lives, after graduating from college. She is now about to use her 24th loan amounting to PHP 29,500 as additional capital for her seafood processing business, making "tinabal" (fish or shellfish in vinegar), "guinamos" (shrimp paste), and dried fish and for her food-vending business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jerisa

texts.en:
Jerisa B., a 49-year-old woman, is widowed and has five children, all in school. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother 1 child. Her child is 3 year old.

Stella has owned a food business selling chips, chicken, banana for 7 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Stella`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more cooking oil, banana, potatoes for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan, Stella hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,potatoes,banana

loans.name: Spora

texts.en:
Spora is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 48 Year old woman. She is married and a mother of 6 children. Her children are 27,25,22,18,15,13 years old.

Spora has owned a food business selling potatoes,tomatoes,onions for 10 years.She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Spora`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of  150,000 Tsh in order to buy more onions, potatoes, tomatoes.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Spora hopes to get more food for family, save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, potatoes,onions

loans.name: Fabina

texts.en:
Fabina R., a 30-year-old woman, is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase baking materials

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji B., a 39-year-old woman, is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alison Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela tiene una pensión familiar donde vende almuerzos y refresco, este negocio le ayuda para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación 
Vive en la zona Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite, papa, y arreglos de la pensión)
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, por su historial es calificada como una clienta excelente, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pamela has a family boarding house where she sells lunches and soft drinks. This business helps her to be able to pay the food and education expenses. She lives in the Alto San Pedro region of the city of La Paz in her own home. The loan is to buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and to make repairs to the boarding house. This is the fourth time that she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her history shows that she is qualified as an excellent client. With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Griselda Reynaldina

texts.es:
Griselda, le ayuda a su esposo en la comercialización de ladrillos ya que tienen un vehículo que hace el servicio de transporte de ladrillos en cantidad, es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y otros de su familia. 
Vive en la zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para construcción ( construcción de una habitación y mejorar sus condiciones de vida )
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda sells bricks with the help of husband. They own a vehicle for transporting large quantities of bricks. This is the only source of income to cover the cost of food and other expenses for their family. Griselda lives in her own home in the Llojeta district in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used for constructing a room in her house. This is Griselda’s fourth loan with IMPRO, which will give her the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in her house

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo trabaja como costurero y su esposa es niñera y le ayuda para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y otros en su familia.
Vive en la zona de Alto San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la construcción de una habitación y mejorar sus condiciones de vida
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, tiene un excelente historial crediticio.

loans.use: CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es:
La señora Gissela A. tiene 35 años D. edad, con 3 hijos, casada, su domicilio se ubica en santa clara, distrito D.  Ate,  departamento D.  Lima. Actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “los Capullitos”.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  hace 1 año y 5 meses, su alcancía comunal esta conformada por 11 socios los cuales realizan diversas actividades como venta D. salchipapa, venta D. ropa, venta D. zapatos usados, servicio D. mototaxi, arreglos y confecciones, limpieza D. hogar y otros. 
Gissela se dedica  a la venta D. ropa según pedidos desD. hace un año, comenzó vendiendo comida en un mercado y como no le generaba muchos ingresos, decidió cambiar D. rubro y optó por la venta D. ropa a domicilio que hasta el momento le va muy  bien, gracias a sus esfuerzos y su trabajo  logro comprarse un mototaxi y arreglar su casa. Su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D.  ropas D. diversos modelos para cubrir los pedidos solicitados y en realizar mantenimiento D. su mototaxi.
 
En el futuro anhela  comprase un auto  para ponerlo a  trabajar como taxi y poder así generar mas  ingresos para su hogar
texts.en:
Mrs Gissela A., 35, is married with 3 children and lives in Santa Clara, in the district of Ate, department of Lima. She currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "Los Capullitos" and has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for 1 year and 5 months. Her communal bank is maD. up of 11 partners who work in different activities, such as the sale of sausages and fried potatoes, the sale of clothes, the sale of used shoes, mototaxi services, repairs and dress-making, cleaning houses and others.

Gissela has been working in the sale of clothes to order for one year. She started selling food in a market, which didn't generate much income, so she decided to change direction and chose to sell clothes at home which has worked very well. Thanks to her efforts and work, she has been able to buy a mototaxi and repair her house. She will use the new loan to buy different types of clothes to meet her orders and to maintain her mototaxi. In the future, she would like to buy a car to use as a taxi to be able to generate more income for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For investment in the purchase of different types of clothing to meet orders and the maintenance of her mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Guadalupe Rogelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto de La Paz y es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Vive en la zona de San Isidro Alto de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de su suegra.
El crédito será destinado para el tratamiento medico ya que el seguro no le cubre para poder hacer el análisis de su vista.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a teacher at a school in the city of El Alto de La Paz, and this is her only source of income. She lives in her mother-in-law’s home in the neighborhood of San Isidro Alto in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for medical treatment, since she needs to take a vision test and her insurance does not cover it. This is the second time that Guadalupe has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical treatment

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Ana Bertha H. tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente, con 3 hijos, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Horacio zevallos distrito de Ate departamento de Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 3 años, Actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” integrada por  10 socios quienes realizan  actividades de servicio y comercio.
Ana se dedica a la venta  de productos de belleza desde hace 3 años,  también hace trabajos manuales como el pegado de lentejuelas desde hace un año. Con su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maderas  y palos para apoyar  a su esposo en su trabajo ya  que él es maestro albañil (las maderas y palos se utiliza como soporte para realizar los techados de las casas y cuando no se cuenta con lo necesario se tiene que alquilarlos y por lo tanto reduce su ganancia).
Ana hasta el momento ha  logrado construir  las paredes  de su casa con material de concreto, anhelando en el futuro poder techar su casita, ya que con la ayuda de su esposo ambos cooperan para que sus sueños se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha H., 42, lives with her common law husband and 3 children in the Horacio Zevallos area, district of Ate, department of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for 3 years and currently occupies the role of president of the village bank "Las Violetas", made up of 10 partners who work in service and trade activities. Ana has worked in the sale of beauty products for 3 years, also doing handi-work like gluing sequins for the past year. With the new loan, she will invest in buying wood and poles to support her husband in his work as a chief bricklayer (he uses the wood and poles as support for roofs of houses and when he doesn't know whether they will be needed, he rents them which reduces his profit).

Until now, Ana has been able to build the walls of their house with concrete but in the future she would like to be able to roof their house, and with the help of her husband they can work together to make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and poles to support her husband in his work as chief bricklayer (he uses the wood and poles as support for roofs of houses and when he doesn't know whether they will be needed, he rents them which reduces his profit).

loans.name: Juana Aide

texts.es:
Juana tiene una oficina en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz que funciona como notaria de fe pública,.
Vive en la zona de Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de equipos y muebles para su oficina).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Juana has an office in downtown La Paz where she operates as a notary public. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of La Paz in her own home. The loan will be used for capital investment (the purchase of equipment and furniture for her office). This is the second loan that she has applied for with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Investment (purchase of equipment and furniture)

loans.name: Jhonathan Vincenth

texts.es:
Jhonatan vive en la AV. Eduardo Avaroa en la zona Obispo Indaburo en la ciudad de La Paz., vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja en taller propio y realiza conexiones de gas a domicilio.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con unas pequeñas herramientas y capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: COMPRA DE EQUIPOS PARA TALLER

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: COMPRA DE EQUIPOS PARA TALLER

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano (The Good Samaritan) Group

texts.es:
L. Señora Isabel F., entusiasta y emprendedora, tiene 29 años D. edad, casada, tiene un hijo D. 7 años, que es el motivo D. su vida, su domicilio esta ubicado en Huaycan distrito D.  Ate,  departamento D.  Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desD. hace 1 año, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía comunal “El Buen Samaritano”  eligieron el nombre, por  L.  solidaridad que existe  entre ellos como grupo,  el cual esta integrado por 10 socios, quienes realizan diversas actividades: venta D. anticuchos, venta D. ceviches en forma ambulante, venta D. cosméticos, tejidos y otros
Isabel y su esposo cuentan con una pequeña bodega ubicada  en L. zona alta D. Huaycan, desD. hace 18 meses, abastecen  a sus clientes principalmente en los productos D. primera necesidad así como también se dedica desD. hace 10 años, a L. venta D. tejidos manuales diversos como: tapetes, chalinas, adornos y otros, con el  cual le permite generar mas ingreso para su hogar.
Con su reciente préstamo lo utilizara en L. compra D.  productos D. primera necesidad para mantener surtida su bodega y  fidealizar  a sus clientes.
Isabel en el futuro anheL. hacer  crecer su bodega y también le gustaría comprarse un carro D. transporte público para generar más ingreso  para mejorar L. educación D. sus hijos y más adelante poder  comprarse una casa en L. avenida principal D. huaycan
texts.en:
Mrs Isabel F., 29, enterprising and enthusiastic, is married with a 7-year-old son (the reason for her life) and lives in Huaycan, in the district of Ate, department of Lima.

She has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for one year and currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "El Buen Samaritano" (The Good Samaritan). They chose the name based on the solidarity that exists within the group, which is maD. up of 10 partners who work in different activities: the sale of anticuchos (skewered meat), the travelling sale of ceviches (raw fish), the sale of cosmetics, fabrics and others.

Isabel and her husband have a small grocery store in the high area of Huaycan where for the past 18 months, they have supplied their clients with essential products and for the past 10 years they have sold hand-maD. fabrics like tablecloths and cravats, ornaments and other things, which has enabled them to generate more income for their home.

Isabel will use the new loan to buy essential products to keep her shop well stocked and to serve her clients. In the future, she would like to expand her store and also buy a taxi to generate more income, improve her children's education and, later on, buy a house on the main street of Huaycan.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential products to keep her grocery store well stocked and serve clients.

loans.name: Ivan Vicente

texts.es:
Iván C. vive en alquiler con su familia en la c/Julián Apaza la zona Villa Pabon en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como chofer asalariado durante el día y por la noches estudia, el crédito que solicita es para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y de esta manera terminar la carrera y poder conseguir un empleo mejor que le permita dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede obtener un credito.

loans.use: ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS

loans.name: Valdivia

texts.es:
Valdivia P. tiene domicilio propio en la calle 1 de llojeta el Vergel con su esposo e hijos, los ingresos que ella tiene es por la venta de mantas que ella misma elabora y también los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de papa, el esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil pero en diferentes pueblitos, el crédito que solicita es para la construcción de su vivienda y de esta manera dar comodidad a su familia.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Valdivia P. lives with her husband and children in their home on First Street in Llojeta el Vergel. She earns money from selling hand-made blankets and on the weekends she works selling potatos. Her husband works as a mason's assistant in different villages. The loan she is requesting is for construction work on her home. These improvements will allow her family to live comfortably. She has already been a client of Impro and paid back her loan on time, so she has access to new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Estanislao Roberto

texts.es:
Estanislao paga alquileres en Vergel (LLojeta), es estudiante de la carrera de informática, trabaja reparando computadoras e instalando programas de esta manera genera sus ingresos, en su domicilio actual instalo un taller de reparación de equipos de computación, el crédito que solicita es para legalizar la licencia de funcionamiento y de esta manera seguir manteniendo esta fuentes de ingresos ya que le esta yendo muy bien.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Estanislao rents a home in Vergel (Llojeta). He is a computer science student. He works repairing computers and installing programs on them. In his home, he built a repair shop for computers. The loan he is requesting is to aquire a business license and in this way maintain his business legally becaue the business is going very well.

He has already been a client of Impro and paid back his loan, so he is eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business license to open computer repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of dairy cows

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor  vive en la c/Canónigo Ayllón  la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz
 
El señor vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, trabaja en su propio taller de carpintería, elabora muebles y hace sus respectivos arreglos en general a pedido.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo invertido en madera, con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Víctor lives in the neighborhood Canónigo Ayllón in the Alto San Pedro region of La Paz.

He lives in a house with his children. He works at his own carpentry shop where he makes furniture. Generally he makes his pieces by special order.

Thanks to the loans he has received previously he has a small amount of capital invested in wood which has put him in better shape financially.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Alison Roxana

texts.es:
Alison vive en la c/Buenos Aires de la zona Las Lomas en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
La señora vive junto a sus padres y se dedica a la elaboración de calzados a contrato y pedido, comercializa sus productos en la zona del Rosario.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
LUIS vive en la  Av. Jaimes Freyre en la zona Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz, vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja con su movilidad propia. el crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su vivienda.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con unas pequeñas herramientas de mecánica y capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luís lives on Jaimes Freyre Ave. in the Alto Sopocachi neighborhood in the city of La Paz in his parents' home, but he has his own transportation for work. The loan that he seeks is to renovate his home. Thanks to the previous loans he has received, he has some small mechanical tools and some working capital, which have improved his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing tools

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.es:
Telesforo vive en casa propia con su hijos en la calle los pinos de la zona de Achachicala de La Ciudad de La Paz percibe una renta de jubilación con la cual mantiene a su familia, el crédito que solicita es para legalizar los documentos de su vivienda y de esta manera vivir mas tranquilo ya que su vivienda esta en un lugar alejado y puede ser sujeto de loteadotes.

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Telesforo lives with his children in his own house on Los Pinos Street, in the neighborhood of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. He receives a retirement pension that he uses to support his family. He will use the loan he is requesting to register the deed to his property. This will allow Telesforo to live with greater peace of mind, since his property is in a remote location and might otherwise be subject to development. Telesforo is a customer of Impro and was very good about making his previous payments - he can therefore apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Registering the deed to his property

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Inés C.  trabajadora, entusiasta y emprendedora tiene 49 años D. edad, casada, con 3 hijos, natural D. Huarochiri, habita por la asociación  El huscaran- distrito D. Chaclacayo, departamento D. lima. Actualmente asume  el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Paz y Progreso”.
Viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace  5 años, su alcancía comunal esta integrada por  12 socios, quienes  realizan diferentes actividades como: producción, comercio y servicio.
Inés se conoció con su esposo en  una renovadora D. calzados ambos trabajaban ahí, se enamoraron, se casaron y decidieron abrir su propio negocio, con la denominación  la renovadora “Enciso” en el cual ambos trabajan y  se dedican a la renovación, confección y venta D. calzados desD. hace más D. 10 años y para incrementar los ingresos en el hogar Inés también trabaja prestando  servicios D. limpieza D. hogar desD. hace 4 años.
Su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar materiales para su renovadora como: pegamentos, hormas, cueros, suelas, clavos, etc. 
Inés en el futuro le gustaría mucho ser exportadora D. calzado y también aperturar una bodega  en casa.
texts.en:
Señora Inés C., an enthusiastic and enterprising worker, is 49 years old, married with three children. She is a native of Huarochiri, a member of the El Huscaran association, district of Chaclacayo, Department of Lima. Currently, she is taking on the position of president of the “Paz y Progreso” (Peace and Progress) community bank. She has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 years. Her community bank is maD. up of 12 members who engage in different business like production, trading, and services. Inés met her husband in a shoe repair shop where they both worked. They fell in love, got married, and decided to open their own business, with the name “Enciso”. They both work there and have been involved in the repair, making, and sale of footwear for more than 10 years. In order to add to the household income, Inés has also worked at providing house cleaning services for 4 years. This loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for her shoe repair business, such as glue, molds, leather, soles, nails, etc. In the future, Inés would very much like to be an exporter of footwear and also to have a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in purchasing materials for her shoe repair business such as glue, molds, leather, soles, nails, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David vive en casa propia con sus hijas esta separado de la esposa hace varios años su vivienda queda en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz , la actividad que el realiza es la confección de parcas, chamarras, buzos, mochilas, según el pedido , instalo un pequeño taller en su domicilio pero trabaja solo, en algunas ocasiones contrata dos o tres personas, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien, también es parte de Kiva y puede obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his house with his daughters. He has been separated from his wife for years. His home is on José Saravia street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. He tailors parkas, jackets, jumpers, and backpacks on request. He has a small workshop in his house and works alone. On some occassions he contracts two or three people. The loan is he asking for is to buy material. He is a member of Impro and repays loans very well. He is also part of Kiva and can obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying material

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto vive en Villa San Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La paz con sus hijos, percibe una renta de jubilación que le permite cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación, el crédito que solicita es para la refacción de su vivienda que esta un poco deteriorada por la antigüedad además que sus hijos necesitan mayor comodidad. 

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto lives with his sons in Villa San Antonio Bajo in the city of La Paz. He receives a retirement payment that allows him to pay for their food costs. He is asking for a loan for the refurbishment of his house, which is a little deteriorated due to old age. Furthermore, his sons need more comfort. He is a member of Impro and repays very well, therefore he can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House refurbishment

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy vive en anticretico con su esposo e hijos en  la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposo percibe una renta de jubilación con lo cual se mantienen, el crédito que solicitan es para pagar los estudios de su hijo menor y de esta manera darle una profesión para que el pueda trabajar y pueda ayudarlos a ellos ya que son personas de la tercera edad.

Son clientes de Impro y pagan muy bien por lo tanto pueden acceder a un nuevo credito.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her husband and children on Jaimes Freyre Street, in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. Her husband receives a retirement income with which they manage. The loan they are requesting is to pay for the education of their youngest son, thus giving him a profession with which he can in turn, help them because they are elderly. They are Impro clients and pay very well, therefore eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline vive en casa D. los suegros con su esposo e hijos en la calle Rosendo Gutiérrez D. la zona D. Sopocachi D. La ciudad D. La Paz el esposo trabaja con su auto como transporte publico. La actividad que ella tiene es la elaboración D. queques, tortas, empanadas, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar en cantidad los ingredientes D. esta manera tener mayores ingresos.

Es cliente D. Impro y paga muy bien pueD. acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her husband in sons in her in-laws' house on Rosendo Gutiérrez street in the Sopocachi zone of La Paz. Her husband works driving their car. She works as a baker, making sweet breads, cakes, empanadas, etc. She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and to buy her ingredients in bulk so she can make more money. She is a member of Impro, and since she repays very well she can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
Mirtha R.  es una mujer emprendedora, entusiasta tiene 54 años D. edad, soltera con 3 hijos a su cargo su domicilio esta ubicado en la  Asociación El Huascaran – distrito D. Chaclacayo,  departamento D. Lima.
Trabaja  con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad hace 9 meses, asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal ”Madres Laboriosas” la cual esta conformado por  13 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta D. comida, venta D.  productos D. belleza, realizan trabajos manuales, servicio D. mototaxi y otros.
Mirtha  se dedica hace 2 años a  la venta D. productos D. belleza  y a  realizar trabajos manuales como tejidos, bordados y otros. Con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. belleza  en promoción para  incrementar sus ganancias y contribuir a mejorar  la educación D. sus hijos.
En el futuro le gustaría que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mirtha R. is an enthusiastic enterprising woman who is 54 years old. She is single with 3 children in her care. Her home is located in the Asociación El Huascaran in the Chaclacayo district of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 9 months, and has taken on the position of president of the comunal bank "Madres Laboriosas" (Hardworking Mothers) which is comprised of 13 members who are involved in various activities such as: food sales, beauty product sales, manual work, motortaxi service and other activities. Mirtha has sold beauty products for 2 years and also does manual work such as weaving and embroidery. She will use her loan to purchase beauty products on sale to increase her earnings and contribute to the improved education of her sons. In the future, she would like her sons to become professionals, and she would also like to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase beauty products on sale to increase her earnings and contribute to the improved education of her sons

loans.name: Jhonathan

texts.es:
Jhonatan vive en la AV. Eduardo Avaroa en la zona Obispo Indaburo en la ciudad de La Paz., vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja en taller propio y realiza conexiones de gas a domicilio.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con unas pequeñas herramientas y capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jhonatan lives on Evuado Avaroa Avenue in the Obispo Indaburo region in the city of La Paz. He lives in his parents’ house. He works in his own shop, and he makes gas connections in homes. Thanks to previous loans given to him, he has some small tools and working capital, which gives him better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe vive con su esposo el señor Juan Antonio, quien trabaja en una empresa muy importante de nuestra ciudad, con una antigüedad de 20 años cubriendo el área de almacenista; la señora María Guadalupe se dedica al comercio mediante la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos por catalogo; ella  se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años, ya que es un ingreso extra para el apoyo familiar. El motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es para la compra de más mercancía por mayoreo, para invertir en su negocio para así obtener más ganancia.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives with her husband, Juan Antonio. He works for a very important business in our city, with a history of 20 years working in the warehouse. María Guadalupe sells natural products and cosmetics by catalog. She has been in this business for three years. It is an extra income to help the family. The reason she is asking for this loan is to buy more wholesale merchandise in order to invest in her business and get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale natural products to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio R. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera y también en la construcción y reparación de viviendas.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos pequeña y mediana edad, a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta material para terminar y empezar la elaboración de unos pedidos que tiene pendientes para entrega, pero Don José no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar los muebles que tiene que entregar. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar los pedidos y entregarlos a tiempo y así sus clientes estarán satisfechos y lo  podrán recomendar lo con otras personas 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que generar el negocio con está inversión.
texts.en:
Mr José Antonio R. has spent over six years making wooden furniture and constructing and repairing houses. This business is the source of income for his family. He has three young and teenaged children and he wants to give them the best. The business needs material to start and complete the construction of some pending orders to deliver, however José does not have enough money to produce the furniture that he has to deliver. Because of this, he is applying for a loan to fulfill the orders and deliver them on time. If he can accomplish this, his customers will be satisfied and could recommend him to other people. He plans to pay for this loan with the income the business will generate from this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in material for his business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive con sus cinco hijos en el sector Atusparias, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años tiene un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de   Chiclayo (el principal mercado de la ciudad) en donde vende ropa interior, ella compra su mercancía en las tiendas de la ciudad que ofrecen estos productos al por mayor y los vende todos los dias durante las mañanas y las tardes e incluso por las noches.

Este negocio le ha servido para sustentar a su familia durante este tiempo, actuamente, gracias al esfuerzo con el que trabaja, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando carrerás técnicas, mientras que los últimos siguen estudiando en un colegio secundario de la zona; ella da lo mejor de sí para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que es consciente de que su futuro depende de la educación que les pueda brindar.

Dora está solicitando a nuestra Institución un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercancía para mantener su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.

Su más grande sueño es lograr obtener un puesto en los interiores del mercado en el que pueda seguir ofreciendo sus productos, ya que el actual no le ofrece la seguridad necesaria para trabajar tranquilamente.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente, demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad  en sus pagos, por lo que es considerada una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Dora is a 41 year old single mother, who lives with her five children in the Atusparias sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz district 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 15 years she has had a small place on the exterior of the Model Market of Chiclayo (the main city market) where she sells under garments. She buys her goods in the city shops that offer these products to her wholesale and sells them every day during the mornings, afternoons, and even at night. This business has served to support her family during this time. Thanks to her work effort, her first three children are studying technical careers, while the youngest continues studying at a secondary school. She gives the best to mover her children forward as she is aware that their future depends on the education she can provide them. Dora is requesting a 2000 nuevos soles loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of more goods to keep her business and continue to support her children. Her biggest dream is to obtain a place in the interior of the market so that she can continue offering her products because the current place does not offer her the security she needs to work peacefully. She has already worked with us previously, showing responsibility and timeliness in her payments, so is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods to maintain her business

loans.name: Grupo Pasuc Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 7 personas que viven con condiciones económicas muy precarias el cual hace 2 años tomaron sus decisiones para emprender una actividad como un grupo de señoras el cual se dedican a la crianza de animales tales como cerdos, ovejas, gallinas, entre otras, la cual ellas contribuyen económicamente con sus esposos con para los gastos de cocina mensual, con las ventas que realizan de sus animales los cuales lo venden en un municipio llamada San Francisco El Alto, la cual es conocido por la venta de animales, que queda aproximadamente a 35 kilómetros del lugar donde viven cada una de ellas, actualmente acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar su préstamo con las buenas intenciones de comprar más animales y de esa manera poder obtener mejores ganancias mensuales, para el sustento de cada una de sus familias.
texts.en:
This is a group of 7 persons who live in economically precarious conditions. Two years ago, they decided to undertake an activity working together as a group of women, raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and hens. With the revenues that they get from the sale of their animals they contribute economically to the monthly food expenses of their household. The animals are sold in a city named San Francisco El Alto, which is known for the sale of animals and is approximately 35 kilometers from where they live. They are currently requesting a loan from the association ASDIR, with the intention of buying more animals so that they can obtain higher monthly earnings to support each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to purchase animals

loans.name: Grupo "luz" Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 5 señoras hace más de 1 año empezaron a emprender una actividad, surgió a través de una de ellas quien recibió una capacitación con una organización que se dedica a enseñarle a las señoras que quieran y tengan una buena voluntad de poder confeccionar y de esa manera poder realizar una actividad en la comunidad donde viven, se consideran capaz de confeccionar ropas para ellas mismas, y luego empezaron a negociar con las señoras comerciantes del lugar para que compren los productos que ellas realizan, con esta actividad contribuyen a que la comunidad donde viven obtenga desarrollo, y por supuestos a la familia de ellas mismas, actualmente acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar un prestamo para poder incrementar su capital de materia prima, el cual se considera que es de gran beneficio para las pesonas solicitantes.
texts.en:
Over one year ago, this group of five women began to build a business. It came about when one of them received training through an organization that teaches women who want to and have a willingness to make something and through this can perform an economic activity in the community where they live. The women are capable of making clothes form themselves and later began to work with local businesswomen to buy the products they make. Through their business they contribute to the development of their community and of course their own families. Currently, they have joined with ASDIR Association to ask for a loan to increase their amount of raw materials, which would be a great benefit to them.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Tuitamaga

texts.en:
Tuitamaga L.  lives in the town of Satufia Satupaitea.  She is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Tuitamaga owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Tuitamaga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Tuitamaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuitamaga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to diversify her product offerings. Tuitamaga is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by her from SPBD. Tuitamaga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

Iuni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie Fotu is a 66-year-old woman living in the town of Auala.  She is married and has fourteen grown children.  To make a living, Sophie owns and operates a business running a food stall.  Her main source of income from the business comes from selling beef products in the local community.  Sophie has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sophie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Sophie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Sophie is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will also be used to buy more products to sell.  This will be her second loan from SPBD.  Sophie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ogesoo

texts.en:
Ogesoo T. is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Faga.  She is married and has eight grown children.  To make a living, Ogesoo owns and operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro to sell.  Ogesoo has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ogesoo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Ogesoo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Ogesoo is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This will be her second loan from SPBD.  Ogesoo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Hakimullah Group

texts.en:
Hakimullah, who is the group leader of Hakimullah, is married and has seven children.  There are three members in the group, each one of them busy in different tasks; for instance, a retail shop, a full service shop and a P-C-O (Public Call Office), which provides support in communications to businesses and individuals, such as PCO phones. 

They want to become stronger in their businesses, so they are requesting a group loan. Each of the members needs 10000 Afghani to further their work, and will be good clients for KIVA and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company). With a group loan, the members help and support one another throughout the period of the loan. Hakimulla would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To stock their shops

loans.name: Kamin Group

texts.en: Waheedullah who is the group leader Kamin group after hard working he made a group of  Three members each one of them are busy in different tasks like Waheedullah busy in hair dresser shop, Abdul Rahaman busy in catering shop and S. Agha busy in retail shop they wants to become stronger in there business so there for they made a group and wants to containing there business and they requested a group loan each members need 10000 Afghani and to further there work and be a good Client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) Waheedullah  is ensure that they can repay the loan on it is time and he can control the whole group he would like to thank Avery body that help with this process of loan in Jalalabad  Afghanistan.

loans.use: They want to buy necessary things for there business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil was born in 1987. He is single and lives in Ramallah, a city of Palestine.

Khalil owns a beauty salon in his neighborhood. He is requesting a loan of $1,500 which will help him buy marketing products and supplies needed to keep on offering high quality services.

Be part of Khalil’s success. He appreciates your help and thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To buy marketing products and supplies

loans.name: Neli

texts.es: La señora Neli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 06 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza, muy a parte en sus ratos libres, también se dedica a la confección de tejidos, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes que ya saben de la actividad que realiza.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Neli, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Neli belongs to the “Working Women II” communal bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is married, is 56 years old and has 6 children, all of them already independent. Her character and her yearning to carry out her dreams motivated her to launch her own business, to sell groceries with whose profit would contribute to her household income.

From the date of her beginning, she has gained customers. Nowadays, she has regular customers who come to buy from her grocery store daily because her shop has all the products a housekeeper needs and she serves with the personal charisma that characterizes her. She also devotes much of her free time to the making of woven goods; she works with the requests of her customers that already know of her activity.

With this loan of $275, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks; cookies, pasta and salt in packets, milk, boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and articles of personal hygiene in order to continue giving the best service to her customers.

Neli strongly desires to continue working and is very grateful for the Manuela Ramus Movement that helps women like her to have opportunities for self-development in the areas where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La señora Delfina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 42 años, 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la Venta de Anticuchos y Juanes, todos los días a partir de las 6:30 pm. Nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena acogida y sus alimentos le salen muy ricos.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the “Mujeres Trabajando II” (Working Women II) Village Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42, separated, and has four children, three of whom still depend on her. Wishing to see her children become professionals with their own incomes, she decided to start up her own business. She earns her living selling kebabs and juanes every day starting at 6:30PM. She tells us that sales are going nicely, since she is very well received and her food is quite delicious. Right now things are going smoothly for her as she continues with her business; she has steady customers who know her well for her food’s yummy flavors. Delfina plans to use her loan of 800 soles to buy ingredients for her meals, including: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens, crates of eggs, bunches of bananas, lots of pastas and oils, and cooking utensils, all so she can provide quality service. She feels strongly about continuing to sell her food. Later, she wants to expand her business with a restaurant, well-equipped so she can offer her customers the best attention and service. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing her meals.

loans.name: Laly Karito

texts.es: La señora Laly Karito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 28 años y no tiene hijos.Laly Karito, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto y asi poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.Lleva 1 año dedicada en el negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina de maíz, azúcar y clavo de olor, para dar un rico sabor a sus bebidas. Rosa Graciela, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Laly Karito is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Dinámicas II”, which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old, single, and has no children. Laly Karito is a woman who enjoys working, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks. She doesn’t have a set schedule for her business and she enjoys being her own boss. With 300 soles, she started her business by purchasing 3 packs of sodas. She did very well and started to gradually invest more into her business. Her business has been in operation for a year and she is well-known in her neighborhood and other places.

With her loan of 1500 soles, Laly Karito will buy more beverages such as sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands. She will also buy mineral water, carbonated and non-carbonated. Part of the money will also be invested in ingredients such as cornmeal, sugar, and cloves that will give rich flavor to her beverages.

Laly Karito has many goals and is motivated to make them a reality. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed assistance. She is responsible with her loan repayments and will continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas of different flavors

loans.name: Mayra Luz

texts.es: La señora Mayra, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años, 02 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.Se inicio en la venta de pescado seco, hace 03 años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.100 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará pescados secos en sacos, tanto lo que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela.
